question: Which among the following can best define the Neolithic Revolution ?
explanation: The Neolithic Revolution or Neolithic Demographic Transition, sometimes called the Agricultural Revolution, was the worldâ€™s first historically verifiable revolution in agriculture. It was the wide-scale transition of many human cultures from a lifestyle of hunting and gathering to one of agriculture and settlement which supported an increasingly large population. Archaeological data indicates that various forms of plants and animal domestication evolved in separate locations worldwide, starting around 12,000 years ago.
